summary: ZIKV is an emerging arthropod-borne virus (arbovirus) belonging to the genus Flavivirus in the family Flaviviridae. it includes dengue virus 1 to 4 (DENV-1 to -4), west Nile virus (WNV), japanese encephalitis virus (JEV), yellow fever virus (YFV) and tick-borne TBEV. since 2007, ZIKV has spread explosively to cause a series of epidemics in viral genomic RNA is released to the host cell cytosol. the newly synthesized virions then transport from the ER and Golgi body to the cell surface. progeny viruses are released to initiate the next round of infection. a total of 3,544 host proteins were quantified, with 200 being differentially regulated. bioinformatics analysis of regulated host proteins highlighted several ZIKV infection-regulated biological processes. ubiquitin proteasome system (UPS) plays roles in the ZIKV infection process. RNA level at 120 hpi was still quantifiable, although CPE can be detected at this time point. Pearson correlation efficiency was calculated based on the log2 values (protein ratio) from two independent biological replicates. the cutoff for differentially regulated proteins was set as described previously (22) among 3,544 host proteins quantified in this study, 86 were identified as being upregulated, while 114 were identified as being downregulated. quantitative PCR analysis of selected host proteins was performed to verify our MS data. glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase was chosen as the internal control. quantitative PCR analysis indicated that these proteins are upregulated by ZIKV infection in C6/36 cells (P 0.05). the distributions of protein ratios in the categories "rRNA processing," "sRP-dependent cotranslational protein targeting to membrane," and "viral transcription" were significantly lower than the overall distribution. quantitative proteins with their gene symbols and ratios were submitted to PANTHER. tissue culture supernatant (TCS) was collected at 12 and 36 hpi. the virus titer was measured with a plaque assay. knockdown of CHCHD2 can decrease ZIKV production. this suggests that CHCHD2 may promote ZIKV replication. heLa cells were transfected with siRNA against CHCHD2 or plasmid expressing HA-CHCHD2. at 36 h posttransfection, cells were harvested and subjected to WB analysis. antibodies used are indicated, with GAPDH set as endogenous loading control. HEK 293T cells were transfected with reporter plasmids and the indicated plasmids and were infected with SeV at 36 h posttransfection. at 12 hpi, cells were lysed to measure intracellular luciferase activity. bortezomib had a 50% cytotoxic concentration (CC50) in C6/36 cells. after the MTT assay, C6/36 cells were treated with 25.6 nM bortezomib. at 24 hpi, cells were harvested and the intracellular level of ZIKV RNA was quantified by quantitative PCR. at 24 hpi, the intracellular level of ZIKV RNA was measured by quantitative PCR. bortezomib affects ZIKV H/PF/2013 replication in C6/36 cells. at 24 hpi, the intracellular level of ZIKV RNA was measured by quantitative PCR. titer was measured with a plaque assay. bortezomib affects ZIKV strain H/PF/2013 replication in HeLa cells. bortezomib has a CC50 of 829.3 nM in vero cells. bortezomib decreased extracellular ZIKV titers in a dose-dependent manner. we then determined at which stage of ZIKV infection bortezomib functioned. MG132 affects the ZIKV entry process. no significant changes in the intracellular level of ZIKV RNA were observed. a previous study indicated that the UPS plays roles in the DENV-2 infection process at the early stage. MG132, a proteasome inhibitor, was used to inhibit UPS. vero cells were treated with 12.8 M MG132 at different time points prior to or after the addition of ZIKV strain H/PF/2013 at an MOI of 1. at 24 hpi, cells were harvested and the intracellular level of ZIKV RNA was quantified with quantitative PCR. antibodies at day 1 (2 mg), day 1 (0.5 mg), and day 3 (0.5 mg) were infected with ZIKV at day 1. no significant weight loss was observed after ZIKV infection. we therefore examined viral loads in the brain and testis. viral loads in brain and testis were lower in bortezomib-treated mice. at day 14 after ZIKV infection, a slight loss of germ cells can be observed in testis from vehicle-treated mice. representative images from several independent experiments are shown. the RNA level at 120 hpi was still quantifiable, although CPE can be detected at this time point. Pearson correlation efficiency was calculated based on the log2 values (protein ratio) from two independent biological replicates. a total of 3,544 host proteins were quantified. the cutoff for differentially regulated proteins was set as described previously. 86 were identified as being upregulated, while 114 were being downregulated. these proteins were identified by MS data as downregulated. at 96 hpi, cells were harvested and intracellular mRNAs were extracted. the intracellular RNA levels of proteins were measured by quantitative PCR. glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase was chosen as the internal control. the distributions of protein ratios in the categories "rRNA processing," "SRP-dependent cotranslational protein targeting to membrane," "translational initiation," "viral transcription," "nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay" and "fatty acid metabolic process" were significantly lower than the overall distribution. tissue culture supernatant (TCS) was collected from cells overexpressing HA-CHCHD2. knockdown of CHCHD2 can decrease ZIKV production. we found that knockdown of CHCHD2 can inhibit virus-induced beta interferon (IFN-) promoter activity. western blot analysis of CHCHD2 expression in HEK 293T cells. cells were transfected with siRNA against CHCHD2 or plasmid expressing HA-CHCHD2. at 36 h posttransfection, cells were harvested and subjected to WB analysis. antibodies used are indicated, with GAPDH set as the endogenous loading control. HEK 293T cells were transfected with reporter plasmids and the indicated plasmids and were infected with SeV at 36 h posttransfection. at 12 hpi, cells were lysed to measure intracellular luciferase activity. bortezomib had a 50% cytotoxic concentration (CC50) of >160 nM in C6/36 cells. after the MTT assay, C6/36 cells were treated with 25.6 nM bortezomib and infected with ZIKV strain SZ-WIV01 at an MOI of 1. bortezomib affects ZIKV strain H/PF/2013 replication in C6/36 cells. at 24 hpi, the intracellular level of ZIKV RNA was measured by quantitative PCR. at 24 hpi, the intracellular level of ZIKV RNA was measured. Bortezomib affects ZIKV strain replication in HFFs in a dose-dependent manner. bortezomib affects ZIKV infection at the early stage. bortezomib has a CC50 of 829.3 nM in vero cells. bortezomib decreased extracellular ZIKV titers in a dose-dependent manner. bortezomib decreased intracellular level of ZIKV RNA. no significant changes in the intracellular level of ZIKV RNA were observed when cells were treated with MG132 after or during ZIKV infection. MG132 affects the ZIKV entry process, suggesting that bortezomib may affect the ZIKV entry process. MG132 affects ZIKV strain H/PF/2013 replication in HeLa cells in a dose-dependent manner. at 24 hpi, cells were harvested and the intracellular level of ZIKV RNA was quantified with quantitative PCR. nar1 antibody at day 1 (2 mg), day 1 (0.5 mg), and day 3 (0.5 mg) was administered 6 h after ZIKV challenge. no significant weight loss was observed after ZIKV infection. we therefore examined viral loads in the brain and testis. at day 7, viral loads in brain and testis were lower in bortezomib-treated mice. at day 14, a slight loss of germ cells can be observed in testis from vehicle-treated mice. DISCUSSION Mosquitoes are epidemiologically important vectors for ZIKV. the innate immune system plays an important role in resisting pathogen infection (33), which is mainly mediated by three major signaling pathways, the Toll, the immunodeficiency (IMD) and Janus kinase-signal transducer and activator of transcription (JAK-STAT) pathways (34–36) the toll pathway is mainly activated by Gram-positive bacteria, fungi, and viruses. deNV-2 infection in Aedes aegypti activated the JAK-STAT pathway (39) while JEV infection of C6/36 cells disrupted the JAK-STAT pathway via interfering with phosphorylation of STAT (40). in human cells, flaviviruses employ various strategies to evade the innate immune system (41) the ER is an organelle involved in multiple biological processes, such as protein folding and secretion, calcium homeostasis, and lipid biosynthesis. the ER retains incorrectly folded proteins, which can activate the unfolded protein response (UPR) in the ER. ubiquitin plays a vital role in deNV-2 infection at the early stage (29) ubiquitin protein Ub3881 is involved in deNV-2 envelope protein degradation. the UPS plays an important role in the JEV entry process (55) bortezomib can reduce viral load and signs of pathology in ZIKV-infected mice. the identification of bortezomib as an inhibitor of ZIKV infection in vivo provides a potential drug candidate for the treatment of ZIKV infection. multiple homologs of reported apoptosis-related proteins were differentially regulated. the protein with accession number KXJ79329, the homolog of inhibitor of apoptosis protein (IAP) and the protein with accession number KXJ76938, the homolog of PH domain-interacting protein (PHIP) were both downregulated in this study. signaling pathways, the Toll, the immunodeficiency (IMD) and Janus kinase-signal transducer and activator of transcription (JAK-STAT) pathways are mainly activated by Gram-positive bacteria, fungi, and viruses. the activated Toll pathway can lead to the nuclear translocation of NF-B-like transcription factors (36) and control the expression of antimicrobial peptides (AMPs) (37). deNV-2 infection in Aedes aegypti activated the JAK-STAT pathway (39), while JEV infection of C6/36 cells disrupted the JAK-STAT pathway via interfering with phosphorylation of STAT (40). a STAT-like protein, with GenBank accession number KXJ68626, was downregulated at both the mRNA and protein levels in ZIKV-infected cells. the ER is an organelle involved in multiple biological processes, such as protein folding and secretion, calcium homeostasis, and lipid biosynthesis. the ER retains incorrectly folded proteins, which can activate the unfolded protein response (UPR) in the ER. many different viruses have evolved to utilize the cellular the UPS to facilitate viral entry, replication, and egress (51, 52). ubiquitin plays a vital role in deNV-2 infection at the early stage (29). ubiquitin protein Ub3881 is involved in deNV-2 envelope protein degradation. bortezomib, an FDA-approved drug, is an inhibitor of ZIKV infection in vivo. it provides a potential drug candidate for the treatment of ZIKV infection. cytochrome P450 Cyp6a14 was regulated as a result of ZIKV infection. the homolog of inhibitor of apoptosis protein (IAP) and the protein with accession number KXJ76938, the homolog of PH domain-interacting protein (PHIP) were both downregulated in this study. it has been reported that IAP and PHIP showed antiapoptosis functions. CC and grown in modified Eagle's medium (DMEM; Gibco) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS; Gibco), 100 U/ml of penicillin, and 100 g/ml of streptomycin at 37°C with 5% CO2. ZIKV strain SZ-WIV01 (GenBank accession number KU963796) and Sendai virus (SeV) were obtained from the China Centre for General Virus Culture Collection ( ZIKV was added to C6/36 cells at a multiplicity of infection. after 90 min of adsorption with rocking every 15 min, the ZIKV inoculum was removed. after 90 min of adsorption with rocking every 15 min, the cells were washed with phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) labeled peptides were mixed at a ratio of 1 and subjected to SCX fractionation as described previously. LC-MS/MS analysis was carried out on a hybrid quadrupole-time of flight (LC-MS/MS) mass spectrometer (TripleTOF 5600+; AB SCIEX) equipped with a nanospray source. MS spectra were submitted to proteinPilot version 5.0 (AB SCIEX) to perform peptide identification and quantification. a concatenated database containing the ZIKV strain SZ-WIV01 polyprotein sequence and Aedes albopictus protein database was used. HEK 293T cells preseeded in 24-well plates were cotransfected with reporter plasmids. pRL-TK was added to each transfection to normalize transfection efficiency. cells were incubated at 37°C for 4 h, and the supernatant was removed. mRNA was subjected to reverse transcription using Moloney murine leukemia virus (MMLV) reverse transcriptase (Promega) a series of 1:10 dilutions were made by mixing 20 l of virus sample with 180 l of DMEM. the plates were incubated at 37°C for 3 days. injection three times: 2 mg at 1 day prior (day 1), 0.5 mg at 1 day after (day 1), and 0.5 mg at 3 days after (day 3). mice were humanely euthanized at day 7 or 14. brains and testes were harvested for analysis. ZIKV strain was added to C6/36 cells at a multiplicity of infection (MOI) of 1. after 90 min of adsorption with rocking every 15 min, the ZIKV inoculum was removed. at 96 h postinfection, cells were harvested and washed with prechilled PBS. cell pellets were resuspended in lysis buffer (8 M urea–0.2 M Tris, pH 8.0) the protein concentration was measured with a bicinchoninic acid assay. LC-MS/MS detection was carried out on a hybrid quadrupole-time of flight (TOF) LC-MS/MS mass spectrometer (TripleTOF 5600+; AB SCIEX) equipped with a nanospray source. Peptides were loaded onto a C18 trap column and then eluted into a C18 analytical column. iTRAQ 8plex (peptide labeled); cysteine alkylation, iodoacetamide; digestion, trypsin; and instrument, TripleTOF 5600. only peptides with ratio value were exported and used for further analysis. HEK 293T cells preseeded in 24-well plates were cotransfected with reporter plasmids. pRL-TK was added to each transfection to normalize the transfection efficiency. luciferase assays were performed using a dually specific luciferase assay kit. a series of 1:10 dilutions were made by mixing 20 l of virus sample with 180 l of DMEM. after 90 min of adsorption with rocking every 15 min, 2% methylcellulose was added. cells were fixed with 4% paraformaldehyde for 30 min and stained with 1% crystal violet for 30 min. mice were humanely euthanized at day 7 or 14. testis tissues were sectioned, fixed with 4% paraformaldehyde, stained with hematoxylin and eosin.
